p: Other concerns include the antinutritional and allergenic properties of plant proteins. Protein and amino acid digestibility can be diminished by the inhibition of digestive enzymes by protease inhibitors from legumes [ 6]. Plant proteins cause severe allergenic reactions. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) lists soybeans among the eight major foods or food groups that account for 90% of food allergies [ 31]. Furthermore, there is a global seroprevalence of 1.4% for celiac disease caused by specific cereal proteins [ 32]. Due to their thermostability, some plant proteins often maintain their native structure even after processing and thus also their allergic potential [ 33]. Moreover, untreated plant-protein preparations made from soy or pea protein often exhibit an undesired bitter off-taste associated with adhering saponins and volatile off-flavors caused by fat oxidation products such as alcohols, aldehydes, and ketones [ 34].
